CatDescriptText: Mr. William Forbes, student Aliquippa and Mr. William Dorn, millworker, Bellevue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, November 4, 1961, pg. 10 with question: "Do you think that there is any need for building bomb shelters?  If so, who should build them--the individual citizens or the Federal Government?" Mr. Forbes' answer reads: "Yes, we must prepare for the inevitable.  We probably will have war, not an all-out war, but shill war.  The government should have the responsibility to build them because they have created the situation."  Mr. Dorn's answer reads: "Yes, there is a need...It's better that the government build them,  because some individuals will not take the time to do so."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of William Forbes wearing trench coat, holding two books marked "University", standing ion Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of William Dorn wearing zippered jacket, carrying paper bag, standing on Smithfield Street, Downtown
